content.raw:
This has nothing to do with the use of mesh collision geometry. 

DART reduces position constraint error (e.g., unexpected penetration between bodies) indirectly by generating error correction velocity, which is different with ODE. ODE directly changes the pose of the body to correct the position constraint violation without any additional velocity.

The error correction velocity of DART sometimes too large when the penetration is large. To handle this unwanted bouncing, DART has two parameters, which are error reduction parameter (ERP) (similar to ODE's)  and maximum error reduction velocity (ERV).

The current default ERV is 10 m/s. I think this is too large. I'll decrease the default ERP by 0.001 m/s then DART can pass test.
